question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate, professional responses. Make sure the code you generate is executable for demonstration. Develop a frontend video feature for adding animated stickers. After users upload videos, they can select different animated stickers (such as dynamic emoticons, cartoon patterns, etc.) to add to the video, set the position and timing of the stickers, preview the video with stickers in real-time, and export the video when complete.

checklist.title: Is the video upload and processing system fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code provides complete video upload functionality with proper file type validation, size limits, progress indicators, and error handling. Check if the uploaded video is properly processed for manipulation (decoding, frame extraction if needed). Score 0 if video upload is not implemented, 5 if basic upload exists but lacks validation or error handling, and 10 if it includes comprehensive upload features with proper feedback mechanisms.

checklist.title: Is the sticker management system properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code provides a user interface for selecting, previewing, and managing animated stickers. Check if stickers are properly categorized, searchable, and if there's support for user-uploaded custom stickers. Score 0 if sticker selection is missing, 5 if basic sticker selection exists without organization or preview features, and 10 if it includes a well-designed sticker library with preview capabilities and custom sticker upload support.

checklist.title: Are the position and timing control mechanisms for stickers implemented?
checklist.description: Check if the code allows users to drag-and-drop stickers onto the video, resize them, rotate them, and set their appearance/disappearance timing. Verify if there's a timeline control for precise timing adjustment. Deduct 3 points if position editing is limited, 4 points if timing controls are missing, and 5 points if the interface lacks real-time feedback during adjustment. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the solution include real-time preview functionality?
checklist.description: Assess whether the code provides a real-time preview of how the video will look with applied stickers. Check if the preview updates immediately when sticker positions or timing are changed. Verify if the preview maintains proper synchronization between video and stickers. Score 0 if preview is not available, 5 if basic preview exists but with performance issues or synchronization problems, and 10 if the preview is smooth, accurate, and responsive to all user edits.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as unsupported video formats, oversized files, browser compatibility issues, resource loading failures, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. AI-assisted sticker placement recommendations 2. Motion tracking to attach stickers to moving objects 3. Custom animation paths for stickers 4. Audio-reactive stickers that respond to sound). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple video players coexisting) 2. Function modules unrelated to video sticker editing (e.g., a built-in social network) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., unnecessary background animations). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating video processing/UI/sticker management layers), unit test coverage, and build process automation. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the build process is not automated. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during fast scrubbing through the video, and 5 points for hard-to-find key function buttons (like export). The full score is 10 points.
